title: Momentum-direction of third piece after explosion

content.description: A stationary block explodes, breaking into three pieces of masses <math alttext="m" overflow="scroll"><mi>m</mi></math>, <math alttext="m" overflow="scroll"><mi>m</mi></math>, and <math alttext="3 m" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn><mi>m</mi></math>. The two pieces of mass <math alttext="m" overflow="scroll"> <mi>m</mi> </math> move off at right angles to each other with the same magnitudes of momentum <math alttext="m v" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>m</mi><mi>v</mi></mstyle></math>, as shown in the figure.
content.question: What is the direction of the momentum of the piece having mass <math alttext="3 m" overflow="scroll"> <mn>3</mn> <mi>m</mi> </math> immediately after the explosion?

choices.label: The figure shows an arrow pointing diagonally upward and to the right.
The figure shows an arrow pointing diagonally downward and to the left.

content.answer: The figure shows an arrow pointing diagonally upward and to the right.
